intro: Louisiella paludosa, commonly known as the marsh lousewort, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in marshes and along stream banks. Its small, white or pinkish flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Louisiella paludosa is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves, and it plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its wetland environment.
